intro: Batopilasia byei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Batopilasia byei requires well-draining soil and indirect sunlight to thrive.
